key_points: Navy medic Max Soviak from Berlin Heights, Ohio, was killed in a bombing at the Kabul airport.
Soviak was a 2017 graduate of Edison High School in Milan, Ohio.
He died alongside 12 other U.S. service members and more than 170 Afghans.
The attack has been claimed by ISIS-K, a terrorist organization in Afghanistan.
Edison High School Superintendent Thomas C. Roth described Soviak as a good student and well respected.
Roth highlighted Soviak's commitment to helping others in need.
The U.S. Navy confirmed the death of a sailor, offering condolences, without naming Soviak directly.
Ohio Senator Rob Portman expressed heartbreak over Soviak's death, calling him a hero.
Portman's statement mentioned Soviak lost his life helping fellow countrymen and Afghan allies.
The local community and schools are mourning the loss of Soviak.
spokespersons: Thomas C. Roth (Superintendent, Edison High School)
